snatch.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to take something away from someone with a quick, often violent, movement
snatch.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The thief snatched her purse and ran.
Keith snatches toys away from the other children.
snatch.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to take someone away from a person or place, especially by force
snatch.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Vargas was snatched from his home by two armed men.
snatch.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to quickly get something, especially sleep or rest, because you do not have very much time
snatch.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: I managed to snatch an hour’s sleep on the train.
snatch.translation[1].definitions[0].def: when someone quickly takes or steals something
snatch.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a very offensive word for a woman’s sex organ. Do not use this word.
